Mount Edwards is a high mountain summit in the Rocky Mountains' Front Range of North America.  The  thirteener is located in Arapaho National Forest,  southwest (bearing 223Â°) of the Town of Georgetown, Colorado, United States, on the Continental Divide between Clear Creek and Summit counties.
